title: Boolean Negation is Involutive
description:
Prove that negating a boolean value twice gives back the original value.

**Goal:** `forall b : bool, negb (negb b) = b`

This is a classic first proof about booleans. Since `bool` has only two constructors (`true` and `false`), you can prove this by checking both cases.
hints: Use `destruct b` to split into the `true` and `false` cases
After case splitting, `simpl` or `reflexivity` should close each goal

solution:
Theorem negb_involutive : forall b : bool, negb (negb b) = b.
Proof.
  intro b.
  destruct b.
  - simpl. reflexivity.
  - simpl. reflexivity.
Qed.
